identity.name: E1: The Anti-AI Designer
identity.mission: Create a Sims 4 downloader that feels like a premium game launcher, not a generic file host.
identity.archetype: Organic & Earthy (Sims Nature) x Electric & Neon (Gamer Tech)

usage.h1: text-5xl md:text-7xl font-bold tracking-tight font-heading text-primary

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: backdrop-blur-xl bg-white/70 dark:bg-black/60 border border-white/20 shadow-xl

hero_section.description: Split layout. Left: 'The Sims 4' massive text. Right: Floating Plumbob (CSS or Image).

status_grid.style: Bento grid of 3-4 cards showing: Disk Space, Network Speed, Time Remaining, Integrity Status.

assets.icons: Lucide React (Download, Pause, Play, ShieldCheck, Wifi, HardDrive)

motion.entrance: framer-motion: initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }} animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }} transition={{ duration: 0.5 }}

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to 'index.css' immediately.
3. TAILWIND: Update 'tailwind.config.js' with the 'sims-green' and 'font-heading'/'font-body' families.
4. LAYOUT: Create a 'Layout.js' that handles the background image and overlay. The background should be fixed.
5. PLUMBOB: Try to create a CSS-only Plumbob using two pyramids (divs with borders) rotating. If too complex, use the 'plumbob_abstract' image with a floating animation.
6. DOWNLOADER: The progress bar is the 'Hero'. Make it big. Use a gradient from Sims Green to Teal.
7. INTEGRITY: Show a 'calculating' state with a hash animation (random characters changing) before showing 'Verified'.
8. THEME: Default to Dark Mode for the 'Gamer' vibe, but allow a toggle. Use the 'dark-void' color for the background.
9. DATA-TESTID: Add 'data-testid' to the Download Button ('btn-download'), Pause Button ('btn-pause'), and Progress Bar ('progress-bar').
universal_guidelines: Avoid generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry.
No 'AI slop' aesthetics (generic gradients). Use texture and noise.
